column4: im trying to get ssh to run, i have an ubuntu computer, which i want to be the ssh server, and a vista computer running     ▒│
│cygwin, from which i want to connect. i assume i have to start sshd on the server (linux), but when doing so it says: Could not load host key: ▒│
│/etc/ssh/ssh_host_rsa_key Could not load host key: /etc/ssh/ssh_host_dsa_key. when trying to ssh from the vista machine, i get the following   ▒│
│error message: connect to the host XXX post XXX: Connection refused
umm well i assume so, but how can i be absolutely sure?
open terminal in ubuntu. sudo apt-get install ssh
yes, and i can ping without problems
im very sure its just some beginner mistake
sorry, but using putty, where do i put in the username and password?
at first the addess below username and password
yeah i got hostname and port, then connection type, and the load, save or delete a stored session
well yeah - when i press open, it says connection refused. i believe it has something to do with my ssh server
